verses.verse: I said <WH559> in my heart, <WH3820> Go <WH3212> to now, <WH4994> I will prove <WH5254> you with mirth, <WH8057> therefore enjoy <WH7200> pleasure: <WH2896> and, behold, <WH2009> this <WH1931> also <WH1571> is vanity. <WH1892>
I said <WH559> of laughter, <WH7814> It is mad: <WH1984> and of mirth, <WH8057> What <WH4100> does <WH6213> it?

I sought <WH8446> in my heart <WH3820> to give <WH4900> myself to wine, <WH3196> yet acquainting <WH5090> my heart <WH3820> with wisdom; <WH2451> and to lay hold <WH270> on folly, <WH5531> till <WH5704> I might see <WH7200> what <WH335> was that good <WH2896> for the sons <WH1121> of men, <WH120> which <WH834> they should do <WH6213> under <WH8478> the heaven <WH8064> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of their life. <WH2416>
I made me great <WH1431> works; <WH4639> I built <WH1129> me houses; <WH1004> I planted <WH5193> me vineyards: <WH3754>
I made <WH6213> me gardens <WH1593> and orchards, <WH6508> and I planted <WH5193> trees <WH6086> in them of all <WH3605> kind of fruits: <WH6529>
I made <WH6213> me pools <WH1295> of water, <WH4325> to water <WH8248> therewith the wood <WH3293> that brings <WH6779> forth <WH6779> trees: <WH6086>

I got <WH7069> me servants <WH5650> and maidens, <WH8198> and had <WH1961> servants born <WH1121> in my house; <WH1004> also <WH1571> I had <WH1961> great <WH7235> possessions <WH4735> of great <WH1241> and small cattle <WH4735> above all <WH3605> that were in Jerusalem <WH3389> before <WH6440> me:

I gathered <WH3664> me also <WH1571> silver <WH3701> and gold, <WH2091> and the peculiar <WH5459> treasure of kings <WH4428> and of the provinces: <WH4082> I got <WH6213> me men singers <WH7891> and women singers, <WH7891> and the delights <WH8588> of the sons <WH1121> of men, <WH120> as musical <WH7705> instruments, and that of all sorts.
So I was great, <WH1431> and increased <WH3254> more than all <WH3605> that were before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem: <WH3389> also <WH637> my wisdom <WH2451> remained <WH5975> with me.

And whatever <WH3605> <WH834> my eyes <WH5869> desired <WH7592> I kept <WH680> not from them, I withheld <WH4513> not my heart <WH3820> from any <WH3605> joy; <WH8057> for my heart <WH3820> rejoiced <WH8055> in all <WH3605> my labor: <WH5999> and this <WH2088> was my portion <WH2506> of all <WH3605> my labor. <WH5999>

Then I looked <WH6437> on all <WH3605> the works <WH4639> that my hands <WH3027> had worked, <WH6213> and on the labor <WH5999> that I had labored <WH5998> to do: <WH6213> and, behold, <WH2009> all <WH3605> was vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit, <WH7307> and there was no <WH369> profit <WH3504> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

And I turned <WH6437> myself to behold <WH7200> wisdom, <WH2451> and madness, <WH1947> and folly: <WH5531> for what <WH4100> can the man <WH120> do that comes after <WH310> the king? <WH4428> even <WH853> that which <WH834> has been already <WH3528> done. <WH6213>
Then I saw <WH7200> that wisdom <WH2451> excels <WH3504> folly, <WH5531> as far as light <WH216> excels <WH3504> darkness. <WH2822>

The wise <WH2450> man's eyes <WH5869> are in his head; <WH7218> but the fool <WH3684> walks <WH1980> in darkness: <WH2822> and I myself <WH589> perceived <WH3045> also <WH1571> that one <WH259> event <WH4745> happens <WH7136> to them all. <WH3605>

Then said <WH559> I in my heart, <WH3820> As it happens <WH4745> to the fool, <WH3684> so it happens <WH7136> even <WH1571> to me; and why <WH4100> was I then <WH227> more <WH3148> wise? <WH2449> Then I said <WH1696> in my heart, <WH3820> that this <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vanity. <WH1892>

For there is no <WH369> remembrance <WH2146> of the wise <WH2450> more <WH5973> than <WH5973> of the fool <WH3684> for ever; <WH5769> seeing that which now <WH3528> is in the days <WH3117> to come <WH935> shall all <WH3605> be forgotten. <WH7911> And how <WH349> dies <WH4191> the wise <WH2450> man? as the fool. <WH3684>

Therefore I hated <WH8130> life; <WH2416> because <WH3588> the work <WH4639> that is worked <WH6213> under <WH8478> the sun <WH8121> is grievous <WH7451> to me: for all <WH3605> is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>
Yes, I hated <WH8130> all <WH3605> my labor <WH5999> which I had taken <WH6001> under <WH8478> the sun: <WH8121> because I should leave <WH5117> it to the man <WH120> that shall be after <WH310> me.

And who <WH4310> knows <WH3045> whether he shall be a wise <WH2450> man or <WH176> a fool? <WH5530> yet shall he have rule <WH7980> over all <WH3605> my labor <WH5999> wherein I have labored, <WH5998> and wherein I have showed myself wise <WH2449> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121> This <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity. <WH1892>
Therefore I went <WH5437> about <WH5437> to cause my heart <WH3820> to despair <WH2976> of all <WH3605> the labor <WH5999> which I took under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

For there is a man <WH120> whose labor <WH5999> is in wisdom, <WH2451> and in knowledge, <WH1847> and in equity; <WH3788> yet to a man <WH120> that has not labored <WH5998> therein shall he leave <WH5414> it for his portion. <WH2506> This <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vanity <WH1892> and a great <WH7227> evil. <WH7451>
For what <WH4100> has <WH1933> man <WH120> of all <WH3605> his labor, <WH5999> and of the vexation <WH7475> of his heart, <WH3820> wherein he has labored <WH6001> under <WH8478> the sun? <WH8121>

For all <WH3605> his days <WH3117> are sorrows, <WH4341> and his travail <WH6045> grief; <WH3708> yes, <WH1571> his heart <WH3820> takes not rest in the night. <WH3915> This <WH2088> <WH1931> is also <WH1571> vanity. <WH1892>

There is nothing <WH369> better <WH2896> for a man, <WH120> than that he should eat <WH398> and drink, <WH8354> and that he should make his soul <WH5315> enjoy <WH7200> good <WH2896> in his labor. <WH5999> This <WH2088> also <WH1571> I saw, <WH7200> that it was from the hand <WH3027> of God. <WH430>
For who <WH4310> can eat, <WH398> or who <WH4310> else can hasten <WH2363> hereunto, more <WH2351> than I?

For God gives <WH5414> to a man <WH120> that is good <WH2896> in his sight <WH6440> wisdom, <WH2451> and knowledge, <WH1847> and joy: <WH8057> but to the sinner <WH2398> he gives <WH5414> travail, <WH6045> to gather <WH622> and to heap <WH3664> up, that he may give <WH5414> to him that is good <WH2896> before <WH6440> God. <WH430> This <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>
